src.gui.aufzug.seil
Class SeilElement

java.lang.Object
  src.gui.aufzug.seil.SeilElement
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class SeilElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

The Class SeilElement. Every element on the rope is an SeilElement. This class calculates the incoming and outgoing point of the rope

Author:
Thomas Bosch (tbosch@gmx.de)
See Also:

Method Detail

getOutPoint

public java.awt.Point getOutPoint()
Gets the point in which the rope leaves the element.

Returns:
the outgoing point

getInPoint

public java.awt.Point getInPoint()
Gets the point in which the rope goes into the element. Depends on the previous element. Sometimes also on the next element.

Returns:
the ingoing point

wichTangentPoint

private int wichTangentPoint(SeilElement prevElement,
                             SeilElement nextElement,
                             java.lang.String ident)
Wich tangent point is the right one. inner? outer? upper? downer? --- / 0 2\ - / \ / \ \ / \ / \ 1 3/ - ---

Parameters:
ident - the identity of the element is the comparing one
prevElement - the previous element
nextElement - the next element
Returns:
the integer mask of the tangent point

isThisUpperPoint

private boolean isThisUpperPoint(SeilElement relevantElement,
                                 java.lang.String ident)
Checks if is this upper point. Determines the upperPoint parameter dependent on whether it is an OutPoint or InPoint

Parameters:
relevantElement - the relevant element
ident - the identifier IN- or OUTPOINT
Returns:
true, if is this upper point

getQuadrant

private int getQuadrant(java.awt.Point p,
                        java.awt.Point rel)
Gets the quadrand, relative to the Point rel, wich is the null-point of the coordinate system ^ | 4 | 1 ---|------> 3 | 2 | Quadrand 1 and three are owners of the axes.

Parameters:
p - the Point to check
rel - the relative Point
Returns:
the quadrand

getUmschlingungswinkel

public double getUmschlingungswinkel()
Gets the enlancement angle Always the smaller angle of the vector rule => cos(alpha) = (a * b) / (|a| * |b|)

Returns:
the enlancement angle in radians (0 ... pi)

oneIsAboveLine

private boolean oneIsAboveLine()
Checks, if at least one in- or out-point of the next or previous element is above the line over the in- and out-point of this element. Above means, in relation to the middle-point of this element.

Returns:
true, if at least one is above line
